acqinfo.p: Belonged to C.A. Tucher von Simmelsdorf (bookplate). From the library of the counts of Lichtenstein.
Acquired from H.P. Kraus in 1962.
Gift of the Kress Foundation.

did.unittitle: Geschlechtsbuch (Nârnberg patrician family histories). Nârnberg.
did.physdesc: Paper, 396 ff.
Bound in brown calf over paper boards.

scopecontent.p: 81 iron engravings by Johnanes Kaler, watercolored. Manuscript prologue. Thought to be a second edition of *170/352 above.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to the Feuerlein and the Kress families (bookplates). From the library of the counts of Lichtenstein.
Acquired from H.P. Kraus, with nos. *170/354-355, in 1964.

did.unittitle: Geschlechtsbuch (Nârnberg patrician family histories). Nârnberg.
did.physdesc: Paper, 110 ff. Prologue is printed, text varies somewhat from *170/353 above.
Bound in parchment over paper boards rebacked s. XVII.

scopecontent.p: 81 iron engravings by Johannes Kaler.

acqinfo.p: Acquired from H.P. Kraus in 1964.

did.unittitle: Chronicle of the city of Nârnberg, 1530-1603 with additions to 1627. Nârnberg.
did.physdesc: Paper, 368 ff.
Bound in parchment stained orange over paper boards.

acqinfo.p: From the library of the counts of Lichtenstein.
Acquired from H.P. Kraus in 1964.

did.unittitle: Offices for the reception and burial of the dead at St. Denis. France.
did.physdesc: Parchment, 19 ff. Written at St. Denis.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to Sir Thomas Phillipps, no.1978.
Source and date of acquisition unknown.

did.unittitle: Desiderius, or the readie way to the love of God. First ... in the Spanish tongue . . . after translated into Latin . . . and nowe lately into Englishe . . . by J[ohn] G[erard?] prisoner. England.
did.physdesc: Paper, 84ff. Apparently the translator's autograph. Original Spanish by Miguel Comalada also translated into English by Lawrence Howell, ca. 1700.
Bound in English brown calf (s. XVIIin) rebacked with the initials E.L. front and back.

acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown.

did.unittitle: Francis I (king of France), 6 letters. France.
did.physdesc: Paper.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to Henry Stevens (1819-1886).
Acquired with the Henry Stevens papers in 1963.

note.p: See N. Thrower, “New Light on the 1524 Voyage of Verrazzano,” Terrae incognitae 11 (1979) 59-65.

did.unittitle: Ps. Augustine, Liber soliloquiorum. Netherlands.
did.physdesc: Parchment, 115 ff. Historiated opening initial and border.
Bound in stamped leather over boards, s. XV/XVI.

acqinfo.p: Acquired from L. Written in 1978.

did.unittitle: Three Accounts of Violent Death, in Italian. Italy (Padua?).
did.physdesc: Paper, 60 ff.

scopecontent.p: The murder of Vittoria Accoramboni Orsini; the deaths of four brothers of the Massimi family who had been cursed by their father (1590); and the execution on 5 March 1562 of Don Carlo Carafa, cardinal, by order of Pope Pius IV.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to Sir Thomas Phillipps, no.2433.
Source and date of acquisition unknown.

did.unittitle: Petrarch, Rime. Italy (Florence?).
did.physdesc: Parchment, 100 ff.
Bound in quarter leather over paper boards.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to Sir Thomas Phillipps, no. 4044.
Acquired from L. Written in 1978.

note.p: See D. Dutschke, Census of Petrarch Manuscripts in the United States (Padua 1986) 155-157.

did.unittitle: Petrarch, Trionfi, etc. Italy.
did.physdesc: Paper, 162 ff.
Bound in green calf over paper boards, s. XVIII.

scopecontent.p: Includes the oldest dated manuscript of the life of Petrarch.

acqinfo.p: Owned by the Minocci family of Siena, s. XV. Belonged to Sir Thomas Phillipps, no. 9477.
Acquired from H.P. Kraus in, 1980.

note.p: See Census of Petrarch Manuscripts, 157-159.

did.unittitle: Statement of the hidalguia of Luis Perrote. Spain.
did.physdesc: Parchment, 28 ff.

acqinfo.p: Acquired in Spain in 1969.

did.unittitle: Cicero, De amicitia (beginning only). Italy.
did.physdesc: Paper, 1 quire of 10 leaves. Unbound, with remains of front cover.

acqinfo.p: Acquired with the collection of C.K. Ogden (1889-1957) in 1958.

did.unittitle: Rabbi Samuel, Sermanes etc. Poland (Poznan).
did.physdesc: Paper, 166 ff. Written by Johannes Faber of Poznan in 1405.
Bound in parchment over boards, s. XV.

acqinfo.p: Acquired from B. James in 1980.

did.unittitle: Fioretta novella estratto della Bibbia. Venice.
did.physdesc: Paper, 112 ff.
Bound in contemporary wooden boards rebacked, s. XV.

acqinfo.p: Acquired from B. Rosenthal in 1980.

did.unittitle: Confessional manual (1 quire). S. France.
did.physdesc: Parchment, 8 ff. Portable book in Latin and Provencal.
Bound in parchment over paper boards, s. XIX.

acqinfo.p: Acquired from S. Katz, Los Angeles, in 1981.

did.unittitle: Francesco Priuli, Rifugio dei Miseri. Italy.
did.physdesc: Paper, 59 ff.
Bound in parchment over paper boards, s. XVIII/XIX.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to the Rev. Walter Sneyd.
Acquired from B. Rosenthal in 1981.

note.p: The first three novellas appear in the same order in Harvard University, Houghton Library MS Type. 24.

did.unittitle: George of Trebizond, Commentary on Cicero, Pro Q. Ligario. Northern Italy.
did.physdesc: Paper, 70 ff.
Bound in inked paper over paper boards.

acqinfo.p: Acquired from B. Rosenthal in 1981.

did.unittitle: Antonio de Pozzi, Torquato Tasso, Canzone, stanze. Italy.
did.physdesc: Paper, 1 quire of 8 ff. Unbound.

acqinfo.p: Acquired from Caldini (Florence) in 1981.

did.unittitle: Henry of Rimini, De quattuor virtutibus. Germany.
did.physdesc: Paper, 174 ff. Written (signed in cyphers and dated) by Leonard Gulsa. Elaborate inhabited pen initials plain and in color, some incomplete.
Bound in stamped pigskin over beveled boards.

acqinfo.p: Acquired from L. Written in. 1981.

did.unittitle: Ludolph of Saxony, Super Psalterium. Cologne.
did.physdesc: Parchment, 234 ff.
Bound in stamped leather over reused boards, s. XV.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to the Carthusians of St. Barbara in Cologne (ex libris, erased). From the Bradfer-Lawrence Collection.
Acquired from Quaritch in 1982.

did.unittitle: Reinmar von Zweter, Poems, in German. Germany.
did.physdesc: Parchment, 2 fragments of a roll.

scopecontent.p: Removed from the binding of **A1T36s St. Thomas Aquinas, Summae theologiae secundae partis pars secunda, Strasbourg: 1470.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to the Benedictines of St. Emmeram in Bavaria. From the collections of Eduardo J. Bullrich (bookplate), and C.K. Ogden (1889-1957), whose library came to the University of California in 1958.

note.p: See R.H. Rouse, “Roll and Codex: The Transmission of the Works of Reinmar von Zweter,” Mûnchener Beitrâge 32 (1982) 107-123; and Rouse and F. Bâuml, “Roll and Codex: A New Manuscript Fragment of Reinmar von Zweter,” Beitrâge zur Geschichte der deutschen Sprache und Literatur 105 (1983) 192-231, 317-330.

did.unittitle: Varia medica. S. Italy.
did.physdesc: Parchment, 51 ff.
Bound in half red leather over paper boards.

acqinfo.p: Acquired from B. Rosenthal. Given by Franklin Murphy and the Research Library in honor of Lynn T. White, jr., in 1983.

did.unittitle: Ludolph von Suchen et al., Voyages to the East. Bavaria.
did.physdesc: Paper, 96 ff.
Bound in red morocco (Spain), s. XX.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to the Benedictines of St. Sebastian, Ebersberg (ex libris).
Acquired from L. Witten. Given by Franklin Murphy and the Research Library in honor of Lynn T. White, jr., in 1983.

did.unittitle: Giovanni da Sulmona, Opera. Sulmona.
did.physdesc: Paper, 105 ff. Only surviving copy of this poet's works.
Bound in mottled calf (worn), s. XVIII.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to the Franciscans of San Niccolò, Sulmona.
Acquired from H.P. Kraus in 1984. Given by the Friends of the Library. See Census of Petrarch Manuscripts, 159-165.

note.p: Signed and dated by the scribe Antonius Marianicus Sulmotinus, who wrote one of the two extant copies of Barbato da Sulmona's works (also from S. Niccolò, Sulmona O.F.M.).

did.unittitle: Politian, Letter regarding the origin of Florence, to Piero de Medici (n.d., n.p.). Italy.
did.physdesc: Paper, 2 ff.

scopecontent.p: In folder with nineteenth-century transcription.

acqinfo.p: Given by the Center for Medieval and Renaissance Studies in 1984.

did.unittitle: Ps. Phalaris, Epistolae, trans. Francesco Griffolini Aretino. Italy (probably Naples).
did.physdesc: Parchment, 54 ff. Written in a well-formed humanistic script by Pietro Ursuleo of Capua who worked in Naples and then Rome. Occasional contemporary annotations.
Bound in crushed red morocco.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to Stanley Morrison (1889-1967).
Acquired from B. Rosenthal in 1984.

did.unittitle: Anthony of Parma, Sermones. Germany.
did.physdesc: Parchment, 112 ff. Front and back pastedowns from a Hebrew manuscript.
Bound in half leather over wooden boards reused and reinforced, s. XV.

acqinfo.p: Acquired from B. Rosenthal in 1983.

did.unittitle: Trattato de Mascalcia. Italy.
did.physdesc: Paper, 99 ff. Treatise in Italian on veterinary medicine (horses). Unbound.

acqinfo.p: Acquired from B. Rosenthal in 1983.

did.unittitle: Florilegium of spiritual texts. Netherlands.
did.physdesc: Paper, 331 ff. A small pocket book with model initials and decoration designs on the front flyleaf. Rear pastedown: liturgy, s. XII.
Bound in stamped leather over boards, s. XV.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to the Benedictines of Huys (ex libris). Bradfer-Lawrence Collection.
Acquired from Quaritch in 1984.

did.unittitle: Florilegium from the works of St. Augustine. Germany.
did.physdesc: Paper, 314 ff. A small pocket book in ledger format written by Fr. Albert de Hamm.
Bound in contemporary stamped parchment over wooden boards.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to the Brethren of the Cross, Ostberg (ex libris).
Acquired from B. Rosenthal in 1984.

did.unittitle: Eusebius, etc. Germany.
did.physdesc: Paper, 58 ff.
Bound in stamped pigskin over wooden boards, s. XVI.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to the Carthusians of Buxheim (ex libris).
Acquired from B. Rosenthal in 1984.

note.p: Item or items removed from binding before acquisition.

did.unittitle: Johannes de Bado Aureo (John Trevor, d. 1410), De arte heraldica. England.
did.physdesc: Parchment, 29 ff. Written by Nicolas Warde.
Bound in parchment over paper boards, s. XVIII.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to Thomas Giffard s. XVI, and to Thomas Martin (1697-1791).
Acquired from A. Thomas in 1985.

note.p: Part of the same manuscript is at Queen's College, Oxford.

did.unittitle: Sermones de tempore et de sanctis. Germany.
did.physdesc: Paper, 320 ff. Front and rear pastedowns from manuscripts, s. XIII.
Bound in stamped leather over wooden boards, s. XV, with fore-edge tabs.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to the Carthusians of Erfurt (ex libris). From the Bradfer-Lawrence Collection.
Acquired from B. Quaritch in 1984.

did.unittitle: St. Augustine, De vita Christiana; Bonaventure, De septem donis Spiritus sancti; Nicholas of Dinkelsbühl, De septem malis . . . Germany.
did.physdesc: Paper, 144 ff. Small pocket book.
Bound in stamped leather over boards (rebacked), s. XV.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to the Benedictines of Liesborn (ex libris).
Acquired from P. Pirages in 1983.

did.unittitle: Hildebert of Lemans, De mysterio missae with gloss. France.
did.physdesc: Parchment, 12 ff.
Bound in brown calf, s. XVIII.

scopecontent.p: One quire from a manuscript of Hildebert 's works not recorded in the standard edition of his Opera.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to the abbey of Billy in Besancon (stamp: Ex Bibliotheca Billiana).
Acquired from H.P. Kraus in 1985.

did.unittitle: Nicolaus Upton, De militari officio. England.
did.physdesc: Paper and parchment, 102 ff. With heraldic devices colored.
Bound in quarter green morocco over paper boards.

scopecontent.p: Bound with the proof sheets of Joseph Haslewood's facsimile reprint of The Blasynge of Arms, Wynkyn de Worde, 1496.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to George Townsend, earl of Leicester 1755-1811 (bookplate); Joseph Haslewood 1760-1833 (stamp); Sir Thomas Phillipps (printed label on spine 8958).
Acquired from B. Quaritch in 1985. Given by the Friends of the Library.

did.unittitle: Giunta Publishing House, stock book. Florence.
did.physdesc: Paper, 309 ff.
Bound in a limp leather wrapper, contemporary fore-edge tabs, s. XVI.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to Giorgio Uzielli (bookplate).
Acquired from H.P. Kraus in 1982.

did.unittitle: Planctus Mariae. Italy.
did.physdesc: Parchment. A fragment of a roll.

acqinfo.p: Acquired from B. Rosenthal in 1986.

did.unittitle: Archimedes, trans. by Federico Commandino, etc. Rome.
did.physdesc: Paper, 218 ff. A composite manuscript made up of three parts. The Commandino manuscript served as the printer's copy for the Aldine edition of 1558.
Bound in antique calf.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to the Albani Library (with arms of Pope Clement XI, 1700-1721).
Acquired from Maggs in 1986.

note.p: A substantial portion of the Albani Library is at Catholic University of America in Washington, D.C.

did.unittitle: Jerome Cusatus, Fastorum libri xii. Rome(?).
did.physdesc: Paper, 230 ff. Apparently the author's fair copy in his own hand, with numerous corrections on slips of paper neatly pasted in.
Bound in quarter leather gilt and marble paper over pasteboards; edges uncut.

scopecontent.p: The work correlates the liturgical calendar with the zodiac.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to Frederick North, fifth earl of Guilford (1766-1827) (bookplate). His library, largely collected in Italy, was sold in eight London sales 1828-1835.
Purchased with many others by Sir Thomas Phillipps (his number on printed paper label, 7459).
Acquired from Maggs (catalog no. 1066, #86) in 1986.

did.unittitle: Niccolo di Antonio da Fiesso di Ferrara, Meditationes super passionem Christi; Epide beate Marie virginis ad universos Christi fideles. Ferrara.
did.physdesc: Parchment, 60 ff. Humanist script. Illuminated initial on fol. I restored.
Bound in paper boards, s. XIX.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to the Carthusians of St. Christopher near Ferrara (ex libris); this house was Cistercian until 1454, then Carthusian.
Acquired from B. Rosenthal in 1986.

did.unittitle: Hours of the Virgin, Use of Utrecht. Delft.
did.physdesc: Parchment, 168 ff. 8 initials with characteristic delicate penwork; with peacock on f. 15; places for animals later initials left blank. Written by the Augustinian nuns of St. Agnes in Delft.
Bound in niger morocco.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to Arthur Barry Smith (1843-1925) in 1893 (ex libris).
Acquired from P. Priages in 1986.

note.p: Another manuscript from this scriptorium in Greater Los Angeles is Huntington HM 1127, and a third is owned by R.H. Rouse and M.A. Rouse.

did.unittitle: Heinrich Seuse (Suso), Horologe de sapience, French translation by Joan de Souhabe. Southwest France.
did.physdesc: Paper, 223 ff.
Bound in contemporary whittawed skin over paper boards with two fore-edge ties.

acqinfo.p: Probably belonged to Anne de Polignac (1495-1554), wife of Francois II de La Rochefoucauld.
Château de La Roche-Guyon sale Paris, Hotel Drouot (2 July 1927) no.6.
Acquired from B. Rosenthal in 1987.

did.unittitle: Aelius Aristeides, Oratio de urbe Roma, translated from Greek by Scipione Forteguerri [Carteromachus]. Rome(?).
did.physdesc: Paper, 18 ff. Written by Francesco Baroncini. Unbound. Formerly ff. 203-220 of a larger volume.

scopecontent.p: Apparently the only known manuscript of the Latin translation of this oration. Forteguerri (1466-1515) was a pupil of Politian and a collaborator with Aldus Manutius, for whom he prepared numerous texts for publication. He was important in establishing the Academy in 1502 and from 1504 lived in Rome; he dedicated this translation to Cardinal Galeotto della Rovere (d. 11 September 1507) into whose service he had entered after leaving Venice. Printed in the second edition of the Scriptores historiae augustae, Venice, 1519.

acqinfo.p: Early modern provenance unknown.
Acquired from B. Rosenthal in 1988.

did.unittitle: St. Antoninus of Florence, Summula confessionis. Fondi (S. Italy).
did.physdesc: Paper, 140 ff. Written by Antonio de Capitalibus at the abbey of S. Onofrio in Fondi.
Bound in contemporary Italian bare wooden boards, remains of two fore-edge clasps.

scopecontent.p: Apparently copied from the edition printed by Johann de Colonia and Johann Manthen in Venice in 1474 or that of 1477.

acqinfo.p: Early modern provenance unknown.
Acquired from Maggs in 1988.

did.unittitle: Antonio Beccadelli (Panormita), Alfonsi regis epistolae, Aifonsi regis legationes. Italy.
did.physdesc: Paper, 72 ff. + 10 ff. Written by one person in an italic hand. Final letter added by a contemporary hand. Lacking final leaf or leaves.
Bound in contemporary Italian calf, crudely rebacked; remains of a single fore-edge clasp front to back.

Numerous early signatures and pen trials crossed out: “Iste per me bade . . .,” “Josephus . . . 20,” “Vincentii Morsi liber emptus #20,” “Mandastini (?) achama . . .,' “D'AIoysi d'Her . . . lo,” and following the colophon: “domini Andree & amicorum codex.”

acqinfo.p: Acquired from B. Rosenthal in 1989.

did.unittitle: Collectanea:Vitae patrum (1 f. missing after f. 58); musical scale; Lotario da Segni, De miseria condicionis humanae; unidentified text, incomplete (8 ff. missing after f. 82); Hugh of St. Victor, Soliloquium de arrha animae; Johannes Herrolt, Sermones. West Germany.
did.physdesc: Paper. 180 ff. Written by John of Tübingen, subdeacon of the Cistercian abbey of Salem near Heidelberg (f. 58v, “Per me fratrum Johannem de Tuibingen sacer professus in Salem isto tempore subdiaconus anno domini 1478”). Attractive large floral initial on blue ground; space for initials left unfinished.
Bound in deer skin over wooden boards, s. XV; fragments of medieval manuscripts, one in German, used as pastedowns and quire reinforcement.

acqinfo.p: Belonged, presumably, to the Cistercians of Salem abbey near Uberlingen until the dissolution.
Names: “Johannes Krantz,” “Stephanus Hegar 1452.”
Acquired from B. Rosenthal in 1988.

did.unittitle: Alexander of Villedieu, Doctrinale. Italy (Venice?).
did.physdesc: Paper, 37 ff. Signed by the scribe “Ludovicus” (”Scriptor sum tails demonstrat littera qualis nomen non pono quia Ludovicum laudare nolo. Amen”). Opening page with floral border and heraldic device; 58 illuminated initials of which 33 are unfinished.
Bound in tree calf (s. XVIII/ XIX), rubbed. With the arms of a member of the Orio and Contarini families of Venice (heraldic device f. 1).

acqinfo.p: Given to the Cistercian abbey of San Bartolo in Ferrara by 1546 (ff. 2, 37v “Questo libro sie dela abbadia di san bartholo appresso ferrara MDXLVI”).
Acquired by the abbey of Billy in Besancon (f. 1 ink stamp “Bibliotheca Billiana”).
Belonged to Sir Thomas Phillipps, no.26059.
Acquired from B. Rosenthal in 1988.

did.unittitle: Peter Riga, Aurora. Northern Spain.
did.physdesc: Parchment, 58 ff. Quires of 8 leaves. 2 columns of 32 lines. Attractive pen work initials.
Bound in green morocco, s. XVIII.

acqinfo.p: Medieval and early modern provenance unknown. Inscription “Corby Barrow, Lancaster, 1854,” Belonged to Sidney G. Hamilton, librarian of Hertford College, Oxford, his sale Sotheby's 25 July 1917, lot 4427; to Ronald Coates. From the library of Bent Juel-Jensen (book plate).
Acquired from A. Thomas in 1989.

did.unittitle: Lectern service book. Spain.
did.physdesc: Parchment, 300 ff.
Bound in leather over wooden boards, with metal bosses.

scopecontent.p: A composite volume made up of portions of service books written at various dates, the largest portion written in 1591, other portions in 1676 and 1790.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to a Franciscan house.
Source and date of acquisition unknown.

did.unittitle: Lectern Gradual. Spain.
did.physdesc: Parchment, 219 ff.
Bound in leather over heavy wooden boards with metal bosses and corner supports.

scopecontent.p: Commissioned, according to an attestation at the end of the book, by Juan Fernandes de Paredes and Antonia Cornela his wife from Valladolid for the convent of Bernardine nuns of St. Mary at Avila at the request of his sister Francisca Fernandes, a nun of the convent, in return for prayers for his soul and those of his family. Written by Alonzo Sanchez of Valencia, writer of books in Valladolid, who finished it on 20 November 1539.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to the Monastery of St. Mary in Avila until at least 1 August 1949. Given by Bert J. Brock sometime between then and 1963.

did.unittitle: St. Athanasius of Alexandria, Contra gentiles, De incarnatione Verbi, Latin translation by Ambrogio Traversari (1386-1439), one of five known manuscripts. Italy.
did.physdesc: Parchment, 76 ff. 29 long lines. Written by one person in a humanist hand.
Bound in dark blue straight grained morocco with gilt edges for H. Drury (see below) by Charles Lewis, s. XIXin.

scopecontent.p: Written in Florence or more likely Venice after 1428.
Belonged to the English collector Henry Drury (inscription and date 1824), his sale 1827 lot 400 to Cochrane. Sold by Maggs (cat. 967 [1975] no. 65).
In the possession of a Dutch private collector. Acquired from B. Rosenthal in 1989 with the assistance of the Center for Medieval and Renaissance Studies.

did.unittitle: Indulgentie, stationes et mirabilia urbis Rome, roll. Germany.
did.physdesc: Parchment, a roll made up of four sections sewn together. With ten by one person in a German hybrida with initials in red. Shelved in a box.

scopecontent.p: Contains prayers to be said at the holy sites in Rome in three parts with an extensive listing of Roman churches and monuments. Presumably a pilgrim's roll, written in Germany at the beginning of the fifteenth century.

acqinfo.p: Early modern provenance unknown. Acquired from B. Rosenthal in 1990 with the assistance of the Henry Bruman Foundation.

did.unittitle: Register of the city of Volterra. Volterra.
did.physdesc: Paper (watermark), 1quire of 48 ff., foliated. Written and signed by the notary Ser Jacopo de Uzzano when Lando Salamoncelli of Lucca was podestà. Unbound.

acqinfo.p: Part of the Orisini Collection acquired in 1958.

did.unittitle: Cartulary of Napoleone Orsini, count of Manupello (1353-1370), and his wife Maria da Subiaco. Italy.
did.physdesc: Paper, 219 ff., foliated. In five large quires.
Bound in limp parchment, s. XIV.

acqinfo.p: Part of the Orsini Collection acquired in 1958.

did.unittitle: Giugni family account book, called the Libro grande bianco.
did.physdesc: Paper, 193 ff.; 400 × 310 mm. Written by Andrea di Raffaello Giugni in Tuscany, presumably at Garbo. Contemporary thick tooled hide envelope binding, with 5 straps.

acqinfo.p: A part of the Corsini Collection, which came to UCLA after World War II. See the Giugni account book described above, Charles E. Young Research Library, Collection 952, Box 1.

did.unittitle: Department of Special Collections, Manuscripts Bound in Early Printed Books (excluding pastedowns and flyleaves).
St. Bernard of Clairvaux, Sermones. Italy.
did.physdesc: Paper, 30 ff. Written by one person in a well-formed humanistic script.
Bound in contemporary blind stamped calf over wooden boards, rebacked. Front and back flyleaves: Antiphonal, Italy, s. XIII.

note.p: Bound following Bernardus Claravallensis, Opuscula, ed. Theophilus Brixianus, Venice: Simon Brevilaqua, 1495.

acqinfo.p: Erased ex libris: “. . . de ordine predicatorum.” “Emptus Jeremia die . . . iulii 1649.”
Acquired from Bennett Gilbert in 1984.

did.unittitle: Anon., Commentary on Terence, Adelphoe, lines 237/38-256. Italy.
did.physdesc: Parchment, 1 bifolium, written by one person in an italic hand.

Bound in contemporary Italian black goatskin over beech boards with geometrical tooling. On f. 1, “N. Sig. principe Zuan Maria Baldana” (s. XVex), “Laus Deo 13 luglio 1666,” “Lucretii Palladii 1670,” and an effaced ex libris note.

scopecontent.p: From an unbound quire. Pen drawing in the margin: bearded man with helmet in profile. Pastedown (lifted) of Diogenes Laertius, Vitae et sententiae philosophorum, Venice: Nicolas Jenson, 1475.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to C.S. Ascherson (bookplate).
Acquired by J.R. Abbey (leather book label and pen note on rear flyleaf “J.A. 2746 22 I 1946”); his sale Sotheby's 25 June 1965 to UCLA.

did.unittitle: Lives of Vespasian and Titus Caesar. Italy.
did.physdesc: Paper (watermark similar to Briquet no.5954 Eclume), 12 ff. Written by one person in an Italian gothic textualis.

note.p: Bound from an early date following Flavius Josephus, De antiquitate Judaica, De bello Judaico, Venice: Joannes Rubeus, 1486.

acqinfo.p: Ex libris f. i, “Ad usum Joannis Baptistae Olivae, Juris utriusque Doctoris Patavini et amicorum MDLXI.” Belonged to D.A. Cruse (bookplate).
Source and date of acquisition unknown.

did.unittitle: Saints' Lives. Germany.
did.physdesc: Paper, 8 ff.
Bound in nineteenth-century quarter leather over paper boards.

scopecontent.p: Lives of Sts. Kunegunde, Henry II, and Boniface. Written by John of Francis in Mainz or Bamberg after 1481 (colophon, “per me Johannes (sic) Francisci . . . Moguntie in ecclesia Egidii et Constancie”).
Bound following Thomas Aquinas, Super quarto libra sententiarum Petri Lombardi, Venice: Johannes Herbort for Nicolas Jenson, 1481.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to the Jesuit College at Mainz (ex libris: “Liber Collegii Moguntini Societatis Jesu”). Passed to the Jesuits of Buren in Prussia by the early eighteenth century (ex libris: “Collegii Societatis Jesu Burena anno 1728”). Sold at Parke Bernet 12 November ca. 1930 lot 416 (catalog notice). Belonged to Robert Walsingham Martin (bookplate).
Acquired from L. Witten in 1981.

did.unittitle: Computistical Collectanea. Germany.
did.physdesc: Paper, 48 ff.
Bound in contemporary plain leather over wooden boards with pastedowns from two manuscripts.

scopecontent.p: Bound following Johannes Surgant, Manuale curatorum, Basel: M. Furter. 1508.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to Anthonius Wakers (Walhers?) (ex libris on the flyleaf of the printed book: “Codex huius possessor est dominus Anthonius Wakers ...[?] 1556 anno” and his monogram AW). Signature on title page “Iohannes Bonvin,” s. XVII.
Acquired with the Isaac Foot library in 1962.

did.unittitle: Cookbook (recipes in German). Germany.
did.physdesc: Paper, 33 ff.
Bound in contemporary stamped parchment over boards with front and rear pastedowns from a German liturgical manuscript, s. XVI.

scopecontent.p: Bound after Charles IV, Bulla aurea, Venice: Nicolas Jenson, 1477; and Von allen Speisen und Gerichten, Augsburg: Heinrich Stayner, 1530.
The 30 folios of recipes in German are an addition to the printed cookbook.

acqinfo.p: Early modern provenance unknown. Belonged to the count of Wolkenstein and Trostberg (bookplate).
Acquired in 1985.

did.unittitle: Victor Gislain, Dedicatory preface to an edition of Prudentius addressed to Hippolyte Estense, and a second to Lucas Fruter. Belgium.
did.physdesc: Paper, 12 ff.

scopecontent.p: Gislain, a Flemish humanist, edited ancient authors ca. 1560-1643. Apparently Gislain's copy, being prepared for a new edition which never appeared, since no edition of Prudentius by Gislain is known.
Bound in Prudentius, Opera omnia, Basel: A. Cratander, 1527.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to R.P. Joseph Varesi (”ex libris Josephi Varesi S. Sacre Vaticane Basilice canonici dei 3 Augusti 1755-1760”). From the library of Isaac Foot.
Acquired with the Foot collection in 1962.

did.unittitle: Dante col sito, et forma dell 'inferno tratta dalla istessa descritione del poeta (Venice: Aldus Manutius). Italy.
did.physdesc: Bound in red morocco gilt tooled, s. XVII.

scopecontent.p: With extensive manuscript annotations by the Florentine humanist Piero Vettori 1499-1585 who owned this book.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to Karl Freiherr Toffholz von Colberg H.H. Hauptmann (book plate).
Acquired from Salloch in 1983.
